website_summaries.verdict: The portability and built-in access point of this model allows users to use their devices on the go without using cellular data or connecting to unsecured public WiFi.
pros: The primary benefit of this model is its portability
For users on the go who want to avoid data overages, it provides a great option
Eliminates security concerns for those who use unsecured public WiFi spots
Allows users to connect devices to a private network while on the go
The unit also includes an Ethernet port for a wired connection
cons: As expected with a portable access point, the router may lag or lose connectivity in areas with weak internet signals

customer_reviews.title: Keeps on dropping the 4G connection
customer_reviews.text: I bought one to be used as router for a video surveillance system. It works fine for about 8 hours or so, then drops the 4G connection. I have to come back to the remote site, logon, and hit the reconnect button to re-establish the link. I need to have it connected continuously, but it refuses to stay up for more than 8 hours.
customer_reviews.author: EVE

customer_reviews.title: TP-Link N150 + Pantech UML290 = Perfect together on Verizon!
customer_reviews.text: Ok - so there's lots of information on the web - but I had significant difficulty getting specific answers about THIS until, along with the Pantech UML290 on the Verizon network. So - having now received all the parts - I can advise 100% that this works - and works well. I'm getting approximately 32 Mbps down, 12 Mbps up. All with a $10 monthly fee. The configuration on the TP-Link is pretty straightforward - you shouldn't have too many issues. Good luck to all!
customer_reviews.author: Barry

customer_reviews.title: ... feed weather data to many different Weather gathering sites like Wunderground, CWOP
customer_reviews.text: Not using this as a normal router but rather flashed it with different firmware to act as a weatherbridge device to feed weather data to many different Weather gathering sites like Wunderground, CWOP, PWS and Open weather maps. For something this small it has very good range without external antenna's through 3 walls which is pretty difficult for any wireless router. For what I needed it for it works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Andyk1

customer_reviews.title: Not Compatable with my Verizon USB551L 4G Modem
customer_reviews.text: IMHO ... TP-Link Technical Support NOT up to the task to connect my USB modem to the WWW. The technician assigned to my case was uninformed and requested information not pertinent to the Verizon device. As a portable wireless router the TP-Link worked fine if I wanted a Home Network. Returned for full credit and purchased a pricey Cradlepoint MBR1200B wireless 3G/4G router that accepts my Verizon USB Broadband Modem. Start-up of their router was as simple as plugging in the Verizon modem and Power-Up. Input default router password and immediately on the WWW.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Try something else, support sucks to high heaven, some sellers make a bad situation worse.
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you get the v1, not anything higher, those are EU models and do not have 3G usb card support for anything relevant or semi-modern. Some sellers are supplying EU models in conflict with product description. On paper the v1 looks great for US based 4g cards, wish I could have tried it. The TP-Link support was also no help with finding a bin file for working around the issue. Most of their website is broken for hunting these things down.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: It's not perfect for 3g/4g, but it does work with a lot of tinkering
customer_reviews.text: It seems pretty versatile, but it seems to take a lot of tinkering to get it to work reliably. I ended up trying different modems and had to try various different settings before I got it to work the way it should. Online tech support seems pretty weak and the manuals don't tell you much about working with 3g/4g modems.
customer_reviews.author: David M. Calaman

customer_reviews.title: I can confirm that in June 2018 it is still ...
customer_reviews.text: I can confirm that in June 2018 it is still possible to flash the memory on this model and turn it into a Meteobridge server, you are going to need an ObserverIP module to get it to work with any Ambient Weather personal weather stations, I have the WS-2902A. The instructions for flashing the memory using a virtual box could use some improvement, but I did eventually figure it out. When you flash the memory you are completely voiding the manufacturer's warranty, something to keep in mind.
customer_reviews.author: M. Gray

customer_reviews.title: Recommend the Brand.
customer_reviews.text: I give this product 2 stars because the unit I received was defective, this was confirmed by TP-Link Technical Assistance.I give Customer Service 5 stars as I was able to immediately return the unit, same day as received. I needed a portable router immediately, so I had to buy one locally. I chose the TP-Link TL-MR3040 as it has a battery as well as electric plug. I have been very satisfied with the one I purchased. I would buy the Brand again if need arose.
customer_reviews.author: Kioti

customer_reviews.title: Great for Meteobridge applications
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use as a Meteobridge router for a weather station. Can't comment on the stock firmware since I installed the Meteobridge software right away and it works great so far. It's been up and running for a couple of months with no issues. No complaints here. Only complaint is that it doesn't support USB 1.x devices. So I need to install a USB hub which does along with the router. I'll update this review if anything notable happens. Update 8/10/16: Been running 24/7 for nearly two years now without a single problem.
customer_reviews.author: Shimon Mor

customer_reviews.title: Great device...escpecially at this price!
customer_reviews.text: Great little travel router... especially for the price! I reflashed mine to make a small wireless file server to make sharing files as easy as linking to the N150s wifi and uploading or downloading. There are a lot of fun projects you can do with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie C

customer_reviews.title: Works Right Out Of The Box...
customer_reviews.text: This portable router worked right out of the box for me. To test it, I connected the TP-Link via ethernet cable to my Dell (traveling) laptop and made a wireless connection to the internet thru my PC (the secure hot spot) network router (Linksys). The setup menus are very intuitive, easy to follow and understand. I've had portable routers in the past that were a nightmare (if not impossible) to connect with. This one, albeit not the fastest kid on the block, works extremely well, quite reliable. I have yet to try the 3G modem dongle when I travel to the Philippines.
customer_reviews.author: Carl J...

customer_reviews.title: Great product and worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: Once I figured it out, it was a breeze to manage and use. I was having a hell of a time connecting to my office access point - an Apple Airport Extreme. My newer laptop has an Intel 7260 AC card that simply would not cooperate with the Apple. It did connect OK under Win 8.1, but refuses every time on Win 10. So I pulled this out (originally bought to use in hotels) and hooked it up to a free Ethernet jack and a few minutes later I'm connecting right away every time. This unit has a great signal and works like a dream. Definitely worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: W. E. Beck

customer_reviews.title: Works after a firmware update
customer_reviews.text: I love this little router. Works great with my 4G Verizon usb aircard. I did have to update the firmware though, in order for it to work. At first, it would state "aircard not supported" or something like that. Unsupported device. Something. I was not very happy at all with that. Went to TP-Link's website and they had some troubleshooting for that, however it wasn't overly clear that updating the firmware would fix the issue. TIP: when updating firmware, PLUG into the router with the included cat5 network cable. Updating the firmware wasn't overly tricky, and this thing works fantastically with my Verizon aircard. I love this little wifi router. Tiny too.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for a basic travel wifi router.
customer_reviews.text: Nice router. Only thing I don't like about it is the router reboots every time you change a setting. Also, you have to manually login to router and switch from one WiFi system to another, and yes, the router reboots when you do this also. I upgraded to another make and model mini WiFi travel router, so this router now sits in my laptop bag as a backup. Web page access is nice, but the layout could be better.
customer_reviews.author: Eric S

customer_reviews.title: Amazing power and performance in a reliable package.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect - just perfect. I was able to share 3G modems in Tanzania and Mali using this router. Get a local SIM card and USB modem, jack it into this thing, and share with several users in the house. And it's USB powered, so when paired with my Anker Astro E4, we didn't go offline when the power was out. I'm sure it'd be a reliable home/office device, but I've never used it that way. Mainly, it hangs on laundry line, powered by a battery, with a 3G modem. This unit has been in some remote, resource challenged places and never failed me. It's brilliant. And at this price point, amazing.
customer_reviews.author: scottpen

customer_reviews.title: Though not officially supported, it recognized my novatel modem ...
customer_reviews.text: Though not officially supported, it recognized my novatel modem at full CDMA 3G speed. Currently using this to replace a Cradelpoint router that decided to die. My only problem is that there is no pass-through mode as I don't use this as router, but as a method for getting the CDMA connection into my edge router.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Mast

customer_reviews.title: Did not work well as AP and did not support the 3G modem I had
customer_reviews.text: The product, the package and everything else is just perfect. Unfortunately, I discovered that model of Huawei 3G modem I had was not supported by the router. My main goal was to use this device to share internet to my Apple devices. When I used my notebook to act as router and set TL-MR3020 as AP it worked fine the first day. My joy was too early as it stopped working the next day and never again I could get it work as AP with the same setup. Probably something was wrong with my computer, though nothing pointed to that, and when I used another Dlink router everything worked well.
customer_reviews.author: stewi

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product to re-flash and use in place of a computer for uploading my personal weather station data to the Internet. The product worked great out of the box and the flashing process was fairly straightforward using the directions provided by Meteobridge. This "do it yourself" process using the TP-LINK TL-MR3020 and licensing the Meteobridge software saved me about $70 over the cost of purchasing the device preconfigured as "Weatherbridge". It's takes a bit of technical know-how to complete the task, but this was my first time to flash a device and I was able to complete the flashing process without any major issues.
customer_reviews.author: David Hollingshead

customer_reviews.title: A great mobile hotspot device
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice little tool for setting up my own, private hotspot for me and my devices. I really wish it had the ability to connect to wifi and then to VPN and share the VPN connection, but I haven't figured out how to do that yet. Either way - it works as advertised. Setup is a little cumbersome so it helps if you're familiar with setting up a hotspot. It supports some of the more complex router firmwares, too, if you're so inclined. Performance is good, range isn't great but it's good enough for a hotel room. USB powered helps a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Marble68

customer_reviews.title: It will work for what need for PARTIALLY ....  but now what was expected
customer_reviews.text: This box has functions in it to be a AP, WISP, and ability to use 3G/4G ... but what was expecting was an all in one box that did a 3 functions spoke of earlier.... BUT what I got was a box CAPABLE of doing all 3 but to get the 3G/4G DATA, you need to purchase a hotspot usb stick you can plug into the box. This was the reason I was buying this so I DID NOT have to purchase a usb data modem.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Williamson

customer_reviews.title: So useful
customer_reviews.text: This product is so useful, so many different roles. The ability to attach a 3G/4G (even LTE) modem is fantastic. One nice feature that it has is the option of getting internet from LAN port OR USB modem. If LAN internet goes down, switch over automatically to USB.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Y.

customer_reviews.title: "Petit mais costaud", small router but does the job
customer_reviews.text: I am using it in South Soudan, a hardship place, where I work. This is actually the 3rd 3g/4g TP-Link router I am using. Have been using with a ZTE MF699 3g modem to connect my Alexa in South Soudan. I do recommand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Using it as a wireless hub works fine but to connect to hotel wifi with authentication did ...
customer_reviews.text: Although the product does connects to secured wifi as its designed to do, I had no luck whats so ever connecting to a Hotel Wifi. One that requires MAC address to be authenticated . I tried copying my cell phone's mac address since it was authenticated but no luck. Still did not work. Using it as a wireless hub works fine but to connect to hotel wifi with authentication did not. Don't recommend for that purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Slagish

customer_reviews.title: Would like less parts for portable router /AP
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm but prefer for travel the old one I had all one piece this one has charger cube usb cable for power and small cat 5. Works as expected and small but like everything built into one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quick and Easy
customer_reviews.text: This is a small quick to setup router that lets me use my Chromecast in hotel rooms without any issues. As long as it's a decent internet connection, this feeds it out and lets my laptop, tablet , phone and Chromecast connect while only having to sign in to the device connected to the router. I am using it as a WISP router, but it also can be setup as an access point or share a 3G/4G air card, just by sliding a switch and a quick setup. I am very happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Kohl

customer_reviews.title: Great hub for personal weather station
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to transmit weather data to the internet whether my lap top was hooked up or not (via Meteobridge). The initial setup is a challenge, but in the end was not as bad as I expected. Now it is working like a champ!
customer_reviews.author: Arrow

customer_reviews.title: Excellent router for using a cellular usb hotspot
customer_reviews.text: Dependable, easy to setup. Use it with a cellular hotspot usb stick. Perfect for remote locations where need internet to monitor smart home system and have internet access. Will timeout on internet connection if nothing is accessing internet, but reconnects quickly once something does try to go to internet.
customer_reviews.author: Koz

customer_reviews.title: Custom Firmware, 3G Hotspot
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I got this, it was a quick and easy procedure (for me, at least) to put DD-WRT on this. I then used a 3G dongle I already owned and turned it into a hotspot. It works awesome, no complaints! I measured how much power it used via a USB power meter, but it was awhile ago, I don't remember the exact figures. I remember it was remarkably low for 3G idling, about 0.5 amp. maybe 1amp for high usage.
customer_reviews.author: Sparky

customer_reviews.title: Works Like A Charm!
customer_reviews.text: At first I was scared when I took it out of the box and looked at the different modes you could use it for. I plugged it up into the wall, went into my computer's network sharing and it was there. Then I just adjusted my sharing settings and I was done. My purpose for this was strictly to have a secure wifi connection between my laptop and my equipment. I didn't need to have internet access. I've worked all day with no interruption in my connection. I'm very glad I bought this and at such a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: This is my favorite router
customer_reviews.text: As posted on my review for the Mini Tp-Link 703N, OpenWRT for the win. While the 703N arrived with Chinese firmware and documentation, the TL-MR3020 arrived with English firmware and docs. In addition, TP-Link also included a printed copy of the GPL, v3. These guys are doing it rightTM. Currently using this router as an offline Git repo network, in conjunction with a 32GB SanDisk Cruzer Fit. May change it to an offline media-streaming network for my NAS device.
customer_reviews.author: Akoi Meexx

customer_reviews.title: Be Carefull
customer_reviews.text: This requires a LTE USB Dongle, saying it's a LTE modem is false advertising, it's a WiFi USB Dongle adapter.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a device to spread the signal in my apartment. All the walls here are brick and we also have concrete and hardwood doors. This device works well, it does not strenghtens the signal too much but it is enough for what i need. It is very light and small and i plan to use it in my trips. Andit aldo works to empower my blue ray panasonic player thatdid not come with wireless. I have not yet used the3g but i hope it works. For the price it was a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Ana B

customer_reviews.title: Unimpressed
customer_reviews.text: Glitchy, unreliable, and unnecessarily complicated to make it work correctly - I've purchased several TP-Link products and liked them so I'm surprised how clunky this is. Go with another product, even if your needs for a travel router are simple (mine are and it still let me down).
customer_reviews.author: Begby

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I was able to connect this to Cricket’s (AT&T MVNO) service without any issues. You will need to get a GSM USB modem. I purchased Huawei Boltz. You just need to adjust the APN settings inside this router.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie & Ronnie

customer_reviews.title: Great for international travel
customer_reviews.text: Great for travel, especially in Europe where VIN is much more common than the US. There is also a great advantage for me: I don't have to install some bone-headed VIN software from a questionable manufacturer on my computer: let this guy take the hit rather than polluting my computer with junk VIN software.
customer_reviews.author: T. Acar

customer_reviews.title: Converted to a Meteobridge weather station uploader.
customer_reviews.text: Didnt buy this as a router, but as a weather station bridge. I loaded the meteobridge software onto this and it works great! I dont have to run the computer at all anymore to upload to wunderground... Plus now i can also upload to almost all the others at the same time. I have it setup to be wireless to the router. You have to set it up initially wired first.
customer_reviews.author: Karl B

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing!
customer_reviews.text: Did not work for me. Spent 2 hours on the phone with tech support. No help at all.
customer_reviews.author: Beaux

customer_reviews.title: Great for my Meteobridge
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my Meteobridge. Simple to convert it for that purpose. Now my weather station is PC free. Don't buy the ready made version from another source. You'll save money by converting it yourself.
customer_reviews.author: K Traj

customer_reviews.title: Using it for the http: //librarybox. us/ project ...
customer_reviews.text: Using it for the  project. Works perfectly as expected for that purpose. Before I used it for its intended purpose I tried using it as a WiFi bridge/repeater and it would not provide a strong enough connection to work on a completely open, unprotected WiFi network. UPDATE: Since Amazon groups multiple models together for the reviews, this particular review is discussing the "TP-LINK TL-MR3020 3G/4G Wireless N150 Portable Router with AP/WISP/Router Mode".
customer_reviews.author: B. Kozlowski

customer_reviews.title: Awesome and simple to flash as Meteobridge
customer_reviews.text: Used it to connect my Davis VantagePro 2 to the internet. Finally WiFi. and that for only $35 plus a meteobridge license. Powerful little tool.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. No

customer_reviews.title: TP-LINK TL-MR3020 Does it again
customer_reviews.text: Great product, Setup was extremely easy to setup, would highly recommend for any one that uses an USB stick modem 3G/4G as their main internet service,Was able to connect all my wireless devices to the internet, not just my PC..Have used TP-LINK products for many years and have found them to be very reliable, and a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Stuckina8track

customer_reviews.title: I just could not get it to work
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically for the purpose of the wifi extender/repeater function. Try as I might, it just wouldn't work. I returned the unit for a refund. I did not give the unit one star because I did not try its other functions. As far as I know, those other functions work well. By the way, I have other TP-LINK products such as their power line ethernet products and have been very pleased with them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice and Compact Travel Router
customer_reviews.text: I selected this travel router specifically because it could be loaded with DD-WRT. The flashing process was simple and setting it up to pick up a signal from an open hotspot and broadcast my own password protected AP was relatively painless. I'm using this primarily to set up a network when I'm away from home so that I can play TV shows and movies from my phone or tablet (synced via Plex from my media server at home) on a TV via my Chromecast.
customer_reviews.author: William Comiskey

customer_reviews.title: some failures... Algunos daños
customer_reviews.text: the equipment is good some years ago I bought one, but this time the regulator did not work, I did not return because I live in Venezuela, and it is very expensive to make the shipment for the return
customer_reviews.author: OAMC

customer_reviews.title: Got Itself Online Automatically with T-Mobile Dongle Used With Ting
customer_reviews.text: Easily picked up the T-Mobile dongle I bought to use with the Ting network, but took a bit of fussing to get online. I use it as 3G for Internet access, WIFI is off, and Internet is shared via the hardwired Ethernet port. Once I turned off DHCP I could reliably use the Internet from anything I had plugged into it.
customer_reviews.author: Gary S

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your time. The WISP option will not work. Even when the router can connect to the internet, any devices connected to the router via either WAN/LAN will have internet connectivity. This is a complete waste of money. I'll send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo

customer_reviews.title: Could not get this thing configured for ad-hoc network. ...
customer_reviews.text: Could not get this thing configured for ad-hoc network. Tried for 90 minutes. Finally got it to broadcast and connect to one laptop, but never iOS devices.
customer_reviews.author: Mark A Lockett

customer_reviews.title: runs like a champ
customer_reviews.text: Low cost, runs like a champ! Not much to be said about it. I use it with my weather station so data can be sent to various weather reporting sites. TP-Link has some good products that have worked great for me over the years.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: portable openwrt perfection
customer_reviews.text: Using this with a daily build of openwrt for the Linux driver of my Linksys AE3000 USB WiFi dongle. There is no WinXP 64-bit driver for this, so I can't use NDIS wrapper to get it working on the BSD installed on my laptop. This little wonder is the solution, and openwrt is now my favorite Linux distro, for letting me run DragonFly BSD on my laptop. The radio on this is fine, but I already had the USB dongle that I used when booting into Linux.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin C. Woolley

customer_reviews.title: 3G/4G that only delivered 3G
customer_reviews.text: This router with a Verizon network card only connected at 3G speed. It worked well and stable at 3G but for anything other than light email and light web browsing it is pretty much useless.
customer_reviews.author: John and Johanna

customer_reviews.title: Can flash Meteobridge software to the TP-Link N150 v3
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the TP-Link N150 v3 and flashed Meteobridge software. Worked perfectly. It's a great little cheap device.
customer_reviews.author: CompWolf

customer_reviews.title: the best of the best
customer_reviews.text: well i needed a 3G 4G router after a good reading about the available products in the market i found what i was looking for . it is fast small and easy to make the setup and the range of this router will shock you , my house is 140 square meters...... i recommend it for everyone that is loking for a 3G 4G router . I love it ..... Thank you again Amazon
customer_reviews.author: Vick

customer_reviews.title: No Tethering
customer_reviews.text: Does not support tethering from a phone charger cable . Called Customer service - answered in India and rep was barely understandable. Product looks solid otherwise
customer_reviews.author: MrBill

customer_reviews.title: Good repeater function
customer_reviews.text: I am using it as a repeater - works well for purpose. I had to connect directly, give it the SSID and password of the network to repeat. Once that is done, it boosts the signal nicely. Took me a while to understand all the different modes, and to make sense of the instructions - these could be better.
customer_reviews.author: foghorn

customer_reviews.title: and the range was good for a product of its size
customer_reviews.text: Decent portable hub. While we were moving recently, we used this tiny N hub for whole house wifi access. It did a decent job, and the range was good for a product of its size. It did need a weekly reboot though. ( no,obvious visible error light indicators, but it would stop transmitting packets on the lan. ). Decent value for the cost / size.
customer_reviews.author: RoboDad

customer_reviews.title: PirateBoxes Galore!
customer_reviews.text: I never booted up the device long enough to use it. I installed the piratebox software on it and have used them everywhere for sharing files locally. It's great for classrooms, trainings, conferences, or someplace without Internet. Just fire it up, powered by USB port, and share at 802.11N speeds. Fits anywhere. Easy to carry around.
customer_reviews.author: phobos

customer_reviews.title: Works great for that
customer_reviews.text: I used this and flashed it with the Meteobridge firmware for connecting my Davis VantagePro2 weather station to my network. Works great for that, but it may void the warranty by doing so - read the manual if that's a concern.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Needed a small router to use on a cruise to ...
customer_reviews.text: Needed a small router to use on a cruise to share my signal from my laptop! Worked Perfectly! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: antigoullman

customer_reviews.title: So Happy I Got This
customer_reviews.text: I was just able to use this to watch Netflix over a Chromecast in a hotel room. It is fricking awesome and makes travel for work so much better. The only problem is figuring out you need to set it up in 3G/4G WAN only mode to make it work correctly in a hotel took forever to figure out. Most people would have given up before finding the solution.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good backup and portable router works very well with good ...
customer_reviews.text: Good backup and portable router works very well with good performance. I have not had any issues withb it as of yet.
customer_reviews.author: Colin James

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product, was surprise that it would automatic setup a secure network for me.
customer_reviews.author: Marine Reader

customer_reviews.title: Best portable modem ever!
customer_reviews.text: Best portable modem ever! If I lost this or if it stop working, I definitely buy another one immediately
customer_reviews.author: Aras

customer_reviews.title: Bought It For A Project - Very Happy
customer_reviews.text: I picked up this little device to use in building a PirateBox, WiFi local-net file server. I replaced the built in software with the PirateBox software along with all the extras I could find. It's been running for almost a week now as a file server and is doing great! The range is pretty good considering that the unit doesn't have an external antenna. I can get almost 100 feet away from it and still have a usable signal. My plan is to mount the unit in, and powered from my power wheelchair. Wherever I go, I'll be a file server!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonEvil

customer_reviews.title: The Foundation of a Library Box 2
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to build a Library Box 2. See that project on the Internet. The processor and WiFi circuitry in the box allows creating a little file server that serves books to people in the WiFi range. The TP-LINK box does just what is advertised for the Library Box 2 project. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Dwayne Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Great product Great price
customer_reviews.text: Great product Great price!! I have been using this router for more than 2 years now in all my applications for security cameras including vehicle, businesses, security camera boxes, WiFi and failover. It is one of the most reliable routers I have seen!!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Standley

customer_reviews.title: This doesn't work well at all with the Verizon 4G ...
customer_reviews.text: This doesn't work well at all with the Verizon 4G LTE air card by Novatel. Worked intermittently but now not at all. Worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Sheik Yerbouti

customer_reviews.title: It works like a normal wireless router - actually better coverage than any router I have used and it is tiny
customer_reviews.text: I usually power it with either Laptop's USB, or my PowerGen battery pack. First thought that it will be some cheap junk. In the short-term (less than a month of usage), I am impressed with it. It works better and easier to set-up than Li*, Ne*, or Be* brand that I have used. Lots of features too. For this one, you also have an option to load WRT, but I have not play with that yet.
customer_reviews.author: Rei Alexandra

customer_reviews.title: Price worthy
customer_reviews.text: This little monster works amazingly well and with decent coverage. I looked for a router that could accept modems in Rwanda which wasn't bulky, this was the perfect mate. One thing though is that I placed it in a place where there was a wall between my computer and the router a distance of 5 feet and connection is problematic. The power cable is a short, an option for a longer one would be ideal so that it could be mounted on a wall with ease. I opted to buy a long chord multi-plug socket just to accommodate it. For someone who needs to create a wifi-hot spot on the go, TP-Link will solve it for you.
customer_reviews.author: Ara Nashera

customer_reviews.title: Difficulty in hotel
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to use on the road for hotel stays to play chromecast. I am not very tech savvy but had heard this was able to bypass the splash page using wisp to allow my chromecast to work. I tried a few setups without success. After contacting a tech rep we tried to work through it over the phone. Unfortunately we were not able to resolve the issue. I would rate it higher for quality and support however I think people buy this commonly for hotel use.
customer_reviews.author: David Alexander Johnson

customer_reviews.title: or whatever your use this router has what you need at a great price and small size
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased 4 of these things already; not because they fail but because they're reliable, small, energy efficient and get the job done. Satellite offices, cars, media streaming, or whatever your use this router has what you need at a great price and small size.
customer_reviews.author: M. Reyna Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Great device, we use this with the AT&T Unlimited ...
customer_reviews.text: Great device, we use this with the AT&T Unlimited plan, OpenWRT, and EasyTeather Pro for wireless tethering. The USB support lets us plug it into our truck and RV for mobile use. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Hogue

customer_reviews.title: Best decision I've made while living in a college dorm
customer_reviews.text: Both my husband and his friend bought one. Best decision I've made while living in a college dorm. Let my PS3 and Xbox One connect to the wifi with no struggles! Can also be personalized as far as making sure no one boots you off line at any time unless the internet goes out.
customer_reviews.author: Rachelle Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: TP-Link N150 is the best for 3G/4G WiFi. It Converts WiFi to Wireless Network!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best 3G/4G indoor router and portable too, works fantastic with WiFi Hotspots. You won't be sorry with this one.
customer_reviews.author: William Corrothers

customer_reviews.title: Too bad the setup was too complicated.
customer_reviews.text: I could never get this to work even though I'm a technical guy. The browser admin for this thing is too buggy. you try to follow the instructions and then the page gives you an error and you have to start all over. I gave up after an hour of trying to set it up. Returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Laith Zraikat

customer_reviews.title: Nice small unit that works great after you set it ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice small unit that works great after you set it up properly. I'm a communications expert and even I was scratching my head when I had to set it up. Be sure to download the full users guide and even then it was still interesting. I will carry it on all my trips because it does work well and is light and small and cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Carol A. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: works good for wifi on my boat with my USB data stick plugged in
customer_reviews.author: RyanM

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a college student
customer_reviews.text: I got this TP-LINK router for one of my kids and it works perfectly. Pros dd-wrt firmware compatible - a must Great range on a two-stories apartment Cons The stock firmware is junk The bundled ethernet cable is very short
customer_reviews.author: dash-o

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: Flexible product can do several different jobs. I use it to convert my wireless hotspot into an Ethernet connection for my desktop PC which has no wifi.
customer_reviews.author: Larry W

customer_reviews.title: works perfect..
customer_reviews.text: I got it to use in Venezuela with a movistar usb...works perfect...good range for its size
customer_reviews.author: DOR@

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: If you have a USB modem you can buy this and an adapter to power the router in the car. This allows you to setup in-car Wifi so the kids can stream netflix or whatever. Works very well with the Kindle Fire HD. However, my wife's iphone 4s seems to struggle with the Wifi and Pandora. She prefers 3G.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working correctly
customer_reviews.text: After only a couple of months of usage it stopped working with my Verizon USB modem. Same Modem that works when plugged into my laptop. The only reason why i bought this was to use it with that. As a normal AP it works alright. Should have bought a cradlepoint 3G/4G router instead.
customer_reviews.author: savaing Savang

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and easy.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a trip to China and it worked wonderfully in the hotels as my own personal hotspot. Looked at a few others that were smaller, but I liked the idea of sharing the 3g from my laptop (though I have not tried that yet). Easy set-up with the WPS button.
customer_reviews.author: MattO.

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice and good price at under $30.
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice and good price at under $30. Works as a router but my 3G/4G donge was not working so I was not able to test this out fully.
customer_reviews.author: John Behring

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised, I use this in my Motorhome ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised , I use this in my Motorhome when on the road.
customer_reviews.author: ben

customer_reviews.title: Works flawlessly
customer_reviews.text: I was able to plug the TL-MR3020 into a USB port on my laptop (also tried my truck inverter - works fine), then attach my UML290 to the USB port on the TL-MR3020. I customized my WIFI settings (SSID and PW), rebooted the device, and was online. Total setup took roughly 3 minutes. While traveling I use this for my laptop, cell phone, and tablet. Another reviewer stated their UML290 did not work with this router, but mine had zero problems.
customer_reviews.author: Florida Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Not connecting to WAN
customer_reviews.text: The product does not work as described. I was not able to connect to the internet using WiFi nor a modem. The WiFI is an existing working network, but the router would not connect. The same with a modem. I tested the modem to work on a Linux machine, but the router was not able to use this modem or another one I tried. I hope they will fix it because it should be a good product, when it works.
customer_reviews.author: Gulliver

customer_reviews.title: Good!
customer_reviews.text: It is a small wifi router. Yes we know. Other than that it's easy to use. Strong signal is usable in a few rooms over. I'm not sure why most reviewers are complaining about setting it up. You plug it in, Find the IP address and make your changes to the name/wpa keys. Took me 3 mins. You honestly don't need to read the manual. Small, Light, Portable and Easy to use!I haven't used the 3g port so i can't comment on that.
customer_reviews.author: A Flight Attendant

customer_reviews.title: Best Solution
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this items to serve as a wireless NAS for my Nexus 7 tablet. Out of the box, you cannot setup as a NAS. I updated the firmware to OpenWRT and configured it to do NAS as a hotspot and over my home and vzw hotspots. Works like a charm. Now I have all of my media on tap at all times. I definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Great portable router
customer_reviews.text: I use this in my car's glovebox along with a USB wireless broadband modem and a wifi music streaming device. Now everyone in my car can get online and stream music to the car stereo.
customer_reviews.author: Bob "Mad Bomber" Johnson

customer_reviews.title: but overall a good quality router for the price and the size
customer_reviews.text: works :) does not always connect and stay connected though it seems to have some interference issues, but overall a good quality router for the price and the size :)
customer_reviews.author: Chef Mag

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't get it to work in WISP
customer_reviews.text: I spent a couple of hours playing around with this the TP-LINK TL-MR3020 and I just couldn't get it to work in WISP mode. I logged in, followed the quick setup, found my client SSID by scanning, etc. but after a reboot the wireless was no longer working (even though the light was on) and it had not connected to the client WLAN. I tried a couple of different things: multiple reboots, reflashing the firmware, connecting from WLAN and LAN for initial config with no luck. I've also tried the Tenda W150M and although it had a lot of little problems at least it worked the first time around.
customer_reviews.author: Pablo

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I use this to connect my kids kindles an wife's ipad to campground / hotel wifi. I only have to set up one device and everything works fine with no hassle
customer_reviews.author: Drew Para

customer_reviews.title: Set up and use were very easy with my Verizon Pantech USB modem
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this so I could use my Roku when I'm travelling for business staying in hotels with secured wifi networks. Set up and use were very easy with my Verizon Pantech USB modem.
customer_reviews.author: Content

customer_reviews.title: I LIKE IT!!!
customer_reviews.text: I LIKE IT!!!! WORKS AT MY HOME AS A" WIFI HOTSPOT" AS INTENDED....I DON'T TRAVEL ANY MORE...WOULD BE GREAT 4 THAT....MY AT&T WIRELESS TOOK A DUMP & THIS FILLS THE "HOLE"...IF U TRAVEL U DO NEED 110V OUTLET
customer_reviews.author: Rodger B. Terrey

customer_reviews.title: great little router
customer_reviews.text: Bought this router to work with a Verizon LG VL600 USB modem. This item allow us to turn that modem into a wifi connection our wifi enabled devices. Wifi is available throughout our small house. Easy to set up, plug and play. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: magenta

customer_reviews.title: This works great with the Usb hotspot I purchased giving me a ...
customer_reviews.text: Would buy again. This works great with the Usb hotspot I purchased giving me a Home Quality wifi and wired connection.
customer_reviews.author: Edward

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't boost week signals.
customer_reviews.text: It wasn't fast enough for streaming, but it may be because of the weak wifi and cell signal and the rv park we're at.
customer_reviews.author: Eight Ball

customer_reviews.title: They work pretty well in that regard but expect some throughput issues ...
customer_reviews.text: Use these all the time for travel and for work when I need to extend a WIFI signal as a client to provide a hard-wire connection for a device. They work pretty well in that regard but expect some throughput issues when used as a client.
customer_reviews.author: Don Schaening

customer_reviews.title: TP-Link rocks
customer_reviews.text: Been using several TP-Link devices and I still very happy with them. This one was easy to setup, regular TP-Link web interface which I already was familiar with.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Great little router
customer_reviews.text: I used this on my travel to London, its a great little router. You can configure it as a repeater for the wifi signal or plug it into the wall and make it an access point. Setup is real easy and quick.
customer_reviews.author: manjo

product_meta.title: TP-Link N150 Wireless 3G/4G Portable Router with Access Point/WISP/Router Modes (TL-MR3020)
product_meta.description:
Share the freedom of 3G! Powered by a laptop or power adapter, the TL MR3020 allows user to easily share a 3G/3.75G mobile connection with family and friends on the train, while camping, at the hotel, nearly anywhere within 3G/ 3.75G coverage. By connecting a 3G USB modem to the router, a 3G Wi Fi hotspot is instantly established. Travel sized Design and Mini USB Port. What make this router outstanding are its travel sized design and Mini USB Port, which can be connected to a Laptop or Power Adapter to be used as a power supply. As long as you have your laptop, the TL MR3020 can be powered and a wireless cloud is created that can be shared by iPads, iTouches, Android Phones, Kindles and the vast majority of other portable Wi Fi enabled devices. High Compatibility Tested in Field Compatibility is the most important aspect to consider when you're selecting a 3G router. The TL MR3020 is compatible with the ISPs in the regions in which they are sold. We have teams around the globe continually testing our Routers with newly emerged modems to ensure that end users can feel confident that their routers will operate flawlessly where they live and work. One Button Security Setup With One Button Security Setup, the TL MR3020 allows users to instantly setup their security simply by pressing the WPS button on the router and automatically establishing a WPA2 secure connection, which is more secure when compared with WEP encryptions. Not only is this faster and safer than normal security setups but more convenient in that users needn't remember a password! IP QoS Control Your Bandwidth Bandwidth of mobile broadband is limited. With the router's IP QoS function, the TL MR3020 allows optimum utilization of bandwidth and offers bandwidth control over congestion, preventing bandwidth abuse. When sharing your mobile broadband with others, you can decide how the bandwidth is shared based on your requirements.

AMAZON.COM




FROM THE MANUFACTURER
 




Share the freedom of 4G! Powered by a laptop or power adapter, the TL-MR3020 allows you to easily share a 3G/4G mobile connection with family and friends practically anywhere. By connecting a 3G/4G USB modem to the router, a 3G or 4G Wi-Fi hotspot is instantly established. If your exsting device does not support 4G sharing, please upgrade it to the latest firmware.

TRAVEL-SIZED DESIGN AND MINI USB PORT
What makes this router so convenient is its’ travel-sized design and Mini USB Port that can be connected to any Laptop or Power Adapter for power. As long as you have your laptop, the TL-MR3020 you can create a wireless cloud that can be shared by iPads, iTouches, Android Phones, Kindles and the vast majority of other portable Wi-Fi enabled devices. 
HIGH COMPATIBILITY GLOBALLY-TESTED IN FIELD
Compatibility is the most important aspect to consider when you're selecting a 3G/4G router. To ensure the best compatibility between our routers and the modem you would use with the router, TP-LINK has made certain that our 3G/4G Routers are compatible with the ISPs in the regions in which they are sold. We have teams around the globe continually testing our routers with newly emerged modems to ensure that end users can feel confident that their routers will operate flawlessly where they live and work. 
IP QOS – CONTROL YOUR BANDWIDTH
With Quality of Service (QoS), you can determine how much bandwidth is allocated to each application. This ensures optimum utilization of bandwidth by controlling congestion and preventing bandwidth abuse. This way, users of a small network receive committed and specific bandwidth, preventing non-critical applications from degrading network performance. 
FLEXIBLE POWER SUPPLY
TL-MR3020 provides you with a mini USB port to be connected to your laptop or power adapter for power.



EASY TO USE
The TL-MR3020 can be installed quickly and easily almost anywhere. All you need to do is insert the USB modem into a router, search for its wireless SSID on your computer, and then connect to it. You can be online and surfing the internet in no time! Plus, a user guide is included in the provided CD to help you easily set up your wireless internet connections.



ONE BUTTON SECURITY SETUP
The TL-MR3020 features Wi-Fi Protected Setup (WPS) which allows you to setup your security by simply pressing the "WPS" button. This automatically establishes a WPA2 secure connection which is more secure than WEP encryptions. Not only is WPA2 faster than normal security setups, you won’t have to remember a password!



FEATURES
 * Share a 3G mobile connection, compatible with 120+ UMTS/HSPA/EVDO 3G USB modems
 * Portable design, light and small enough for you to take anywhere
 * Wireless N speed up to 150Mbps
 * Quick security setup, faster and safer
 * IP-based bandwidth control allows administrators to determine how much bandwidth is allotted to each connected device
 * A mini USB port to be connected to your laptop or power adapter for power supply
 * 3G/WAN failover guarantees an "always-online" internet connection
 * Three working modes: 3G Router, Travel Router (AP), WISP Client Router


PACKAGE CONTENT
 * TL-MR3020 Router
 * Quick Installation Guide
 * Power Adapter
 * USB Cable
 * Resource CD
 * Ethernet Cable


COMPATIBILITY LIST


Note:

1. If your 3G USB modem is listed but not recognized by the router, please refer to the following steps to have a try:

 * Download and upgrade the router with the latest firmware，which is always compatible with more 3G USB modems and available at http://www.tp-link.com/en/support/download/?productcategoryid=202. 
 * If the problem still remains, please go to http://www.tp-link.us/support/3g/ to check whether there is a bin file for your 3G USB modem. 
 * If your 3G USB modem finally failed to be recognized by the router, please feel free to contact our technical support at http://www.tp-link.us/support/contact/.

2. If you found a 3G Modem is not listed but compatible with our 3G router, please feel free to tell us at http://www.tp-link.us/support/contact/, your kind help is very valuable for other customers.
